intro: Pilosella conflectens, commonly known as the clustered mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and meadows, and it has hairy stems and leaves. Its small, yellowish flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, and it produces small, oblong seeds that are dispersed by wind. Pilosella conflectens is often found in moist or sandy soils and is considered a common weed in many regions.
